column3: str

Something seems to be troubling Maru.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
/doubt the stonemasons at Giantsgall Grounds.
Deliver the sacks of gil owed to Maru.
Our meyhane setup's been bringin' in folk from all over the island and beyond. It's hard work, but the proprietor couldn't be happier to keep the libations flowin'.
That bein' said, no paradise is without its faults. We've got more than a few regulars who keep promisin' to pay, yet keep showin' up with empty purses and goin' home with full bellies.
We keep askin' them to pay up, but it seems our words slip their mind as soon as the liquor slides down their gullet. I was wonderin' if maybe you could help us out with this little problem.

Three of these delinquents are at this very moment workin' at Giantsgall Grounds. I think if a fierce-lookin' <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> like yourself were to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> their intentions to settle with us, they might think twice before shirkin' their debt again.
Hey, I'm workin' here! I don't have time for chitchat!

This man has no interest in conversation, but a healthy dose of <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> might earn his attention.
Huh? The Hippo Riders sent you? H-Hey now, you don't have to scowl at me like that. I have their money—here, take it.
I should've settled up earlier, but you know how things go...right? I'll make the proper apologies soon enough, so you go and tell them how cooperative I was, eh? ...Please?
What, you think I'm some kind of thief!? I'll have you know a friend of mine works at the meyhane, and he's been hounding me to no end. Don't worry—if I was going to run, I'd have done it already.

He doesn't seem too worried about his mounting debt. Perhaps you make him <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> his current financial strategy.
...Huh? You're really in a fit of pique, aren't you? I didn't know the meyhane needed funds <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> badly.
All right, all right, I'll pay what I owe. Don't know what I'd do with my evenings if I couldn't spend them at the meyhane. You go ahead and tell Maru I'll be along with his money within the bell.
Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mister</If>, but as you can see, I'm quite busy...
She seems distracted by her work. Make her <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> her priorities.
What!? You said I owe <Emphasis>how</Emphasis> much!? I'm embarrassed to say, but I'm always four sheets to the wind by the time I settle the bill...

Can you take this to the kind people at Svarna? I've even put in a bit extra by way of apology for my...oversight. And while I'll tell them myself when next I see them, for now I'd be grateful if you apologized in my stead.
I hope there wasn't any trouble. While they can be surly with a few drinks in 'em, they're good-natured in the daylight. Or so I hope.

Well, well─you're still plenty persuasive, it seems. Truth be told, more'n a few of the quarriers comin' to the meyhane to blow off steam are friends and relatives of the good folks helpin' us out here in Svarna.
In the interest of maintainin' good relations, I never pestered them overmuch, but now I'm comin' to realize that some just can't help takin' a malm if you give them an ilm.

I'll have a talk with the proprietor about how we should deal with this problem in the future... I'm thinkin' we'll be needin' a solution sooner rather than later. Thanks for your help today, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
